job_title: Anonymous Employee in El Cajon, CA
pros: Free medical benefits for family.
cons: The culture at GCCCD is "that's how we've always done it". Don't go there if you are motivated and want to make improvements, you will be shut down every step of the way.  The union runs everything and rewards the lazy and unmotivated. There is no accountability upon the staff and I have never witnessed so much complaining by employees that have some of the easiest jobs around. There is a culture of "that is not in my job description", so if you are lazy and unmotivated then go work at GCCCD otherwise do yourself and favor and stay far away. The happiest day at GCCCD was my last day there when I got to leave. There are a bunch of bitter angry people that work there that have been there for so long they don't know what real work is and resist change every step of the way.  There are people that refuse to do their work and complain to managers about things being unfair. Anyone that says anything good about this institution obviously hasn't ever had a job in the real world.

review_title: Grossmont is the best way to start for International students

review_title: Great Benefits but terrible communication and treatment
job_title: in El Cajon, CA
pros:
Benefits (excellent) - Medical, dental, vision, insurance all free for the entire family with excellent copays.

review_title: Maintenance the Gym, fitting and weighting rooms, and the swimming pool.

review_title: Not best pay for community college campus but best campus to work at
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: Working for GC has been great. We put our students first and make sure we do everything in our power to help them meet their goal. We have the highest rat of graduation and transfer for our students. Our Student Success and Life Coach Program is the greatest benefit to our students.
cons: With budget cuts classes are not as plentiful. As a counselor we focus on the best interest of the student.

job_title: Part-Time Faculty in El Cajon, CA
pros: The students are respectful, the faculty is supportive, and it is a pleasant environment with a welcoming atmosphere.
cons: Due to the state budget, only part-time faculty can be hired, which means faculty must find outside employment in order to make a living wage.  When accounting for all of the time spent grading papers, preparing lessons, and meeting with students, new faculty make much less than minimum wage.

job_title: CIS Tutor in San Diego, CA
pros: Hours are flexible and the CIS staff are very supportive. Working with a multicultural community has its perks because it enables you to come up with creative ways to help others understand the material.
cons: The people in charge of the tutoring center are quick to accuse tutors of missing hours or days. The individual in charge of the tutoring center has an appalling lack of tact and is unprofessional.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in San Diego, CA
pros:
Students and co-workers are friendly.
Campus is visually appealing.
cons:
Adjunct faculty are paid only for time spent teaching.   Grading, class prep, office hours, and all other activities performed to prepare a class are not paid.  Students with grants/scholarships/financial aid are receiving more money than professors.
Higher-ups assure adjuncts that student complaints are taken with a grain of salt, which is not true- students make false accusations which are taken seriously.
No benefits (health insurance, sick days, vacation time).
No job security.

review_title: Grossmont College is wonderful for students and staff.

cons: The California budget crisis was the only con to working at Grossmont College. Too many students and too little money and staff.
